titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Studies Program, Yale University, Time Capsule Prepared by the Students of the Course "Public Memory and Material Culture in America"
American Studies Program, Yale University, Time Capsule Prepared by the Students of the Course "Public Memory and Material Culture in America"
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:17

did.unittitle: American Studies Program, Yale University, time capsule prepared by the students of the course "Public Memory and Material Culture in America"

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of a time capsule prepared by Yale students for an American Studies course titled Public Memory and Material Culture in America.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 14-B (YRG 14-B), Records of academic departments and programs of the Yale Faculty of Arts and Sciences.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are restricted until January 1, 2028 due to University policy set by the Yale Corporation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: American Studies Program, Yale University, Time Capsule Prepared by the Students of the Course "Public Memory and Material Culture in America" (RU 822). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of a time capsule prepared by Yale students for an American Studies course titled Public Memory and Material Culture in America.

did.unittitle: Time capsule prepared by the students of "Public Memory and Material Culture in America"
